sentence.idiomatic: This apple is really sweet.
I don't like to drink milk that is too sweet.
This chocolate is a bit sweet.
The food you make smells so good.
I used perfume, so I smell nice.
The cake at this shop is both fragrant and delicious.
This cake is delicious, you can have a taste.
I've tasted it before, the flavor isn't anything special.
Could I have a taste first, then buy it?
Don't listen to his nonsense. He is just a big talker.
I am not talking nonsense, I have a basis for what I am saying.
What nonsense are you talking?
Everyone in our class is very tall.
Everyone is always going on about how cute my son is.
Everyone that goes to that place never wants to come back.
Five RMB for a half kilogram of sweet roasted chestnuts is really inexpensive.
If you only give it to me for two RMB cheaper it's still too expensive.
Can you lower the price on this a little?
Roasted sweet chestnuts! Roasted sweet chestnuts!
Are they sweet?
They are sweet and fragrant.
Can I taste one?
You can. Here you go.
Mmm. Not bad.
I wasn't kidding was I? Everyone who eats them says that they are good.
How do you sell them?
15 RMB per half kilogram.
Why so pricey? Everyone else has them for 10 RMB per half kilogram.
They are not the same. I use the best chestnuts, and roast them right.
They are good. But they are too expensive. Forget it.
How much do you want to buy?
A half kilogram.
Fine, fine, fine. I'll give them to you for one RMB less.
